intro: Dorstenia edeensis, commonly known as the Ede's woodspurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, spirally arranged leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and restricted distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
